content.description: Start on the chunky jug on the left facing blunt arete. Move out and right to a good crimp jug using the arete for the left hand as needed. Continue up using decent holds to reach a horizontal rail (same rail as The Ringer). Top out by pulling left around the arete or going up and right over the lip. Stay right of the arete for a slightly harder but more satisfying finish.
content.location: Located on the far left of the main part of the warm-up wall.

content.description: Start low; grab some good jugs and reach up to a chunky side-pull. Get a high foot and reach through to a horizontal rail (same rail as Warm-Up Arete). Grab the lip and mantel to top out.
content.location: Located to the right of the Warm-Up Arete (Second from the left starting with Warm-Up Arete)

content.description: This is the sweet crack across the way and upcanyon from the warm up wall.  Slightly sandy layback moves up to the top of the cliff.  Very stimulating.
content.protection: Don't bother with a pad cause if you blow off up high you'll probably miss it anyways, perhaps try to land in the low bushes.

content.description: Start on a pinch feature about five feet up. Two or three moves earn you the lip. Two pinch features on the lip make the top out more secure than some.
content.location: Located farthest left on the warm-up wall.

content.description: Start on jug rail, climb past a nice pocket out right to reach opposing side-pulls on the bulge. Reach up and left to a cool tear-drop pinch, grab the sloping lip, and top out.
content.protection: 1 or 2 pads should be plenty. Nice, flat landing.
content.location: Located on the far right side of the warm-up wall, just left of a crack feature.

content.description: Start low on a good pinch. Climb up sloping rails to the lip and top out.
content.location: Located to the right of the Warm-Up Arete (3rd from the left starting with Warm-Up Arete)

content.description: Start low on chunky sloping holds with feet on the skirt. Climb sloping rails to the lip. Small creases and divots on the lip make for a top-out only slightly more secure than the average Kelly Canyon friction-sloper top out.
content.protection: 1 or 2 pads and a spotter. It feels pretty tall when you pull the top, but falls are reasonable and easily protected.
content.location: Located to the left of 7-10 split.

content.description: Start on two pockets 4-5 feet up. Two more sloping pockets earn you the lip. A nice ridge feature further back on the lip makes the top out less precarious than many climbs at Kelly Canyon.
content.location: Located to the left of the Warm-Up Arete

content.description: Start between two trees on good, slightly sloping rails. Move up and right to a sloping jug, then left to a nice side-pull. A pocket above the side-pull gains access to the bulging lip and a good right hand edge. Find another good left hand edge further up the lip and top out.
content.location: Located to the right of Pinball Wizard, between two trees.

content.description: A wall of sweeping gashes with roughly a dozen problems all in a row. No names or grades to speak of really, just follow the weaknesses, nothing here is harder than V6. Lots of high cruxes and slippery, slopey mantel topouts keep it exciting.
